title: Sustainable AI Systems
description: This research aims to develop energy-efficient algorithms for deep learning models that can run on edge devices with minimal energy consumption. We've developed novel pruning techniques that reduce computational requirements while maintaining accuracy.
keyFindings: Achieved 70% reduction in energy consumption for CNN models
Developed adaptive pruning algorithms that adjust to hardware constraints
Created a framework for measuring and optimizing carbon footprint of AI deployments
collaborators: Stanford Green Computing Lab, Microsoft Research

title: Secure Distributed Computing
description: This project investigates methods to secure distributed computing environments while maintaining performance. We're developing privacy-preserving machine learning techniques that allow collaborative model training without exposing sensitive data.
keyFindings: Created a secure federated learning protocol with formal privacy guarantees
Demonstrated resilience against various adversarial attacks
Designed a lightweight encryption scheme suitable for resource-constrained IoT devices

title: Edge Computing Optimization
description: This research explores techniques to optimize the deployment and execution of AI models on edge devices. We're developing methods to automatically partition and distribute computation across cloud and edge infrastructure.
keyFindings: Reduced latency by 65% through intelligent workload distribution
Created an adaptive framework that responds to network conditions and device capabilities
Developed compression techniques specific to edge-cloud communication patterns
